page.title: 18TIMOTHY HACKWORTH-1
page.content: Timothy Hackworth was born at Wylam-on-Tyne on 22nd December 1786and was taught the rudiments of education by the village schoolmaster. At the age of 14 he was apprenticed as a Smith at Wylam Colliery and on the completion of his apprenticeship was promoted to the position of Foremanand took a very prominent part in the introduction of locomotives at Wylam Colliery.A boyhood friend of George Stephenson,who too,was born iat Wylam in 1781, Hackworth was invited by Stephenson to help with the construction of the Darlington & Stockton Railway. Before the line was completed,Stephenson was often absent,being engaged in other undertakings and the spervision of the work suffered in consequence. In 1875 Hackworth was made Engineer & Superintendent of the Locomotive.
